feed.title: Password Pusher Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.54.1: Save Settings Button Now on Every Tab
entry.content:
A bit overdue but the "Save the above settings as the page default." now shows up for every tab. Thanks @ozovalihasan!

:memo: What’s Changed

  • Add a "Save" button into two tabs (#3353) @ozovalihasan

:rocket: Features

  • Latest Language Strings (#3355) @pglombardo

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • :arrow_up: Bump bootsnap from 1.18.4 to 1.18.5 (#3356) @dependabot[bot]

:busts_in_silhouette: List of contributors

@dependabot[bot], @ozovalihasan, @pglombardo and dependabot[bot]

:motor_boat: Docker Images

Available on Docker Hub: https://hub.docker.com/r/pglombardo/pwpush

:running_man: Run This Version

bash docker run -d -p 5100:5100 pglombardo/pwpush:1.54.1

..and go to http://localhost:5100

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.55.0: Add Minio Storage Support
entry.content:

  • feat: Added minio support for S3 storage (#3369) Thanks @AZOGg01!

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.56.0: Unify Push Models - README!
entry.content:
Summary

On boot, this release will run a data migration in the background.

Until done (for most in under 5 minutes) existing push URLs may not work and dashboards may be empty.

Although the data migration has been tested extensively, we suggest making a backup of your database before upgrading to this release as a safety precaution.

Reminder: If you also run the pwpush-public-gateway and/or pwpush-worker containers, they should be updated along with the pwpush container in tandem. e.g. don't run different versions for an extended time so that all features and routes are in sync.

Explanation

This release unifies the backend Push models into one. This is a important improvement that will allow the project to move faster going forward. It will also allow us to migrate features from Premium to OSS more easily.

For the large majority of users, the data migration will take less than 15 minutes maximum. For most users, less than 5 minutes.

After the migration completes, all pre-existing push URLs will work as normally and your dashboard will be repopulated.

Technical Details

The migration job runs in the background job runner that has been part of the Docker container since v1.53.0.

If enabled, you can view the job in the Admin Dashboard:

The data migration will log output to /opt/PasswordPusher/log/migration_data.log. If needed, you can open an application shell to view this file by following these instructions up to step 4.

Thanks to @ozovalihasan for the excellent and complicated work done in this release!

:memo: What’s Changed

  • Update the logger used by MigrateDataToPushModelJob (#3404) @ozovalihasan
  • Add a kind column to the dashboard (#3402) @ozovalihasan
  • Update API responses to make them same with API responses of the Premium one (#3395) @ozovalihasan
  • Audit Log: Use ipaddress partial for links to iplocation.io (#3396) @pglombardo

:rocket: Features

  • Unify different push models and controllers (#3380) @ozovalihasan

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • :arrow_up: Bump turbo-rails from 2.0.13 to 2.0.16 (#3416) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-core from 3.224.1 to 3.225.0 (#3414) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-s3 from 1.188.0 to 1.189.0 (#3411) @dependabot[bot]

  • :arrow_up: Bump google-apis-storage_v1 from 0.51.0 to 0.52.0 (#3408) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump bigdecimal from 3.2.0 to 3.2.1 (#3407) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-partitions from 1.1108.0 to 1.1109.0 (#3406) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump base64 from 0.2.0 to 0.3.0 (#3405) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-s3 from 1.187.0 to 1.188.0 (#3401) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump oj from 3.16.10 to 3.16.11 (#3400) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump bigdecimal from 3.1.9 to 3.2.0 (#3399) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-sdk-s3 from 1.186.1 to 1.187.0 (#3391) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump net-http-persistent from 4.0.5 to 4.0.6 (#3393) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump rubocop from 1.75.7 to 1.75.8 (#3392) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-partitions from 1.1107.0 to 1.1108.0 (#3390) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump google-cloud-env from 2.3.0 to 2.3.1 (#3385) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump selenium-webdriver from 4.32.0 to 4.33.0 (#3384) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump websocket-driver from 0.7.7 to 0.8.0 (#3383) @dependabot[bot]

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.56.1: MariaDB & CVE Fix
entry.content:
This release fixes a bug reported by MariaDB users and resolves a reported CVE in the Docker container. CVE details in #3420

:memo: What’s Changed

  • Push Create: Add fix for MariaDB id type conflict (#3423) @pglombardo
  • CVE-2025-22871: Update to resolve (#3420) @pglombardo

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • :arrow_up: Bump rubocop-ast from 1.44.1 to 1.45.0 (#3421) @dependabot[bot]

entry.title: New release for Password Pusher: v1.56.2: Public Gateway Fix
entry.content:
The recent unification of routes and models in v1.56.0 broke legacy URLs for the public gateway. This release fixes all routes for the pwpush-public-gateway container.

:memo: What’s Changed

  • Public Gateway: Add legacy route redirects (#3428) @pglombardo
  • Update push forms (#3419) @ozovalihasan

:arrow_up: Dependencies updates

  • :arrow_up: Bump aws-partitions from 1.1110.0 to 1.1111.0 (#3426) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump bigdecimal from 3.2.1 to 3.2.2 (#3425) @dependabot[bot]
  • :arrow_up: Bump rack from 3.1.15 to 3.1.16 (#3424) @dependabot[bot]

:busts_in_silhouette: List of contributors

@dependabot[bot], @ozovalihasan, @pglombardo and dependabot[bot]
